column4: Guys, I'm deleting my old linux files & folders from my ext3 drive in live CD from the terminal. Now I got nothing left other than the home folder (which I need). It consumes 6gigs on disk. But the drive properties say "11GB used". I also saw this "some parts unreadable" in the window. How do I delete these "unreadable" files ?
Hope its ok to ask this question here
better to copy the files off and make a new partition...
use an xp disk to restore the MBR
umm, is it still there?
you would boot to a recovery console, and type fixmbr
is that a problem?
umm, i don't think F2 is the proper key
thinking...
what does it say when the cd starts?
what do you mean?  you can't boot to anything until you get the mbr fixed
may i ask why you're dong this?
whoa, you get grub?
wait, so do you see entries?
you could press e, and edit the boot entry to get to windows
k
did you lost the torrent data?
you can just use another client
I like Azureus
w/e
Thx for everything. Got it downloaded. Gonna check it out ASAP
cool, gl
